column4: my flash videos are choppy/low frame rate and have no sound... any help?
if you want to just clean out configuration this will not help
Its not that... i wanted to do the thing where firefox just automatically gets it... cuz the tar.gz i got isnt working the same way as that
to start with a clean config on firefox in terminal do mv ~/.mozilla ~/.mozilla-backup then start firefox

yesterday before i re-installed linux, i clicked "get flashplayer" and it loaded it like an extension, got it, and said to restart..... today its taking me to an adobe page and asking me to get that tar.gz
it is installed, maybe just not responding on some pages.. flash sucks
i know... but do you know how to get that one i was talking about, the one where it loads like an extension would in firefox
if you did it once, it is done, it is installed, thats it, you only do it once
it was flash-nonfree i was referring to
in terminal do 'sudo aptitude search flashplugin-nonfree' if you see an i next to it it is installed
now this is getting on my nerves... every video... no matter the website, is playing intil 2 seconds, then stopping
this is normal, flash is crappy
